snippet: A federal judge approved a $60 million settlement for college athletes in a class-action lawsuit filed against the N.C.A.A. and the video game maker Electronics Arts.
abstract: United States District Court Judge Claudia Wilken approves $60 million settlement in class-action lawsuit against NCAA and video game maker Electronics Arts saying college football and basketball players can claim up to $7,026 each for illegal use of their names and likenesses in video games.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge approved a $60 million settlement for college athletes in a class-action lawsuit filed against the N.C.A.A. and the video game maker Electronics Arts.

headline.main: $60 Million Settlement Approved in N.C.A.A. Video Game Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: $60 Million Settlement Approved in N.C.A.A. Video Game Suit
